span.h6:
“Education is not preparation for life; it is life itself. “
John Dewey

pre.em: (View this page in Spanish here) download Parent & Student Guidebook 2019-20

ul.li: Students must be physically in the classroom before tardy bell rings at 8:25 a.m.
Students who arrive late will need to go to the office for a tardy slip before going on to class.

div.p: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday & Friday Dismissal times:

ul.li: All Grades will be dismissed at 1:35 p.m.

div.p: 2. BUS TRANSPORTATION (TO BE DETERMINED) Individual routes, stops and times
Morning Bus Routes, Monday through Friday
Afternoon Bus Routes, Monday, Tuesday, Thursday & Friday

ul.li: Gualala “Coast” – stops at Mary Star of the Sea Church ONLY
MANCHESTER/POINT ARENA ROUTE stops at both sides of the Manchester/Point Arena Rancheria.

div.p: 3:15 p.m. there is bus service to the Gualala Ridge, Gualala Coast and (TO BE DETERMINED) for Point Arena & Manchester.

ul.li: 1:35 p.m. there is bus service to the Gualala Ridge, Gualala Coast and (TO BE DETERMINED) for Point Arena & Manchester.

h5.strong: Please keep your Back to School Packets all year. They are very helpful and in them, you will find the following documents:

div.p: Staff, Schedules, Calendars and Maps – School Staff List, Bus Schedule, Event Calendar Dates, District Calendar, Instructional Minutes, Master Schedule (TBD), and a School Map. These documents will be separate from the annual guidebook.

Signature Pages -These documents are to be reviewed, signed, and returned the first week of school. Use the cover sheet to help keep the documents in order and return them to the school office or to the classroom teacher.

Arena Elementary School Guidebook – This is the last year the guidebook will be included with the Back to School packet. Guidebooks are available in the school office for those in need of a hard copy. The school guidebook is also available online at http://pointarenaschools.org

Planning ahead is key to a successful school experience the first week, first month or first year for your child. Place a note in your child’s school bag or lunchbox providing updated physical & mailing addresses, and current telephone numbers. This helps the teacher and staff members to contact you, a family member or friend when your child needs you. The first week of school is extremely busy for the office processing students’ Back to School forms and may not have this new information available.
Is your child ordering a school lunch the first week? Please write a note to your child’s teacher indicating if your child will order a school lunch or will bring a lunch from home.
How is your child getting home from school (riding the bus home, picked up from school)? Please plan ahead and discuss with your child where they are going after school.

Please send a note to school indicating where he/she will go at dismissal time. Example: My child will ride the bus home, or be picked up at school, or will go to daycare, or lives locally and will walk home (grades K & 1 must be accompanied by an adult or older sibling to walk home).

p.strong: AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM for Grades 1st through 8th

div.p: The Kudos After School Program (ASP) begins the second day of school, Thursday, August 22, 2019 for students who have returned the completed after school packet prior to Wednesday, August 21. There is a one-day wait period before any student begins the program. All after school program applications are included in the Back to School packet.

p.br: Kindergarten, grades 7 & 8, and newly enrolled students must show proof of immunization to the school office before the student may enter school according to state law.

ul.li: TK/Kindergarten -Polio, DTaP, MMR, Hepatitis B, and 2 Varicella
Grades 7th through 12th -Tdap Booster, Hepatitis B, and MMR
New students must show proof of the above immunizations accordingly. (*This notice applies to students with prior notification from the school office.)

p.br: Class lists will be posted on the bulletin board at school on August 20st after 1 p.m.
